lead_paragraph: Arthur John Patterson was convicted of killing a 22-year-old South Korean college student, a case that has gripped the nation for years.

headline.print_headline: American in South Korea Gets 20 Years in ’97 Killing
headline.main: South Korea Sentences American to 20 Years in 1997 Murder

snippet: Arthur John Patterson was convicted of killing a 22-year-old South Korean college student, a case that has gripped the nation for years.
abstract: American Arthur Patterson is convicted in South Korea of 1997 killing of student Jo Jung-pil and sentenced to 20 years in prison; sentence is maximum for murder committed while minor; Patterson, who was extradited in September, 2015, from United States to stand trial, was 17 at time of killing.
